title: VR-Based Real-World Learning Project for Strengthening Social Work Field Competencies

context.prior_knowledge: Basic knowledge at an introductory social welfare level and fundamental field practicum experience
context.additional_context: Learning environment configuration using low-cost VR tools (such as cardboard viewers) in smartphone-centric limited-technology settings, emphasizing reuse of existing virtual reality materials and development of field-case-based scenarios

learning_goals: VR simulations can be used to analyze three or more situations that may occur in social welfare settings (e.g., client conflicts, crisis interventions) and develop response strategies.
Two or more immersive learning scenarios can be designed and implemented by repurposing existing virtual reality materials.
Communication and problem-solving skills can be improved by 20% or more through PBL activities that combine peer and self-assessment.

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
